property.name: Flavour
property.value:
The stars give these oracles vision, even in the darkness.
At a young age, Alahazra was struck blind and began exhibiting supernatural powers. Accused of being a follower of the gods, she was driven from her atheist home in Rahadoum into the desert. Although the experience almost killed her, she emerged with the realization that her abilities came not from any deity, but from the powers of the sun and flames. Now Alahazra travels the world, exposing any injustice she encounters with her scouring light.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: You may recharge a card that has the Divine trait to examine the top card of any location deck ([ ] or the blessings deck or any character deck). [ ] When you use the above power to examine a card from a location deck on your turn, and it is a boon, you may encounter it. [ ] When you use the above power to examine a card from a character deck, that character may recharge it. At the end of your turn, you may discard a card that has the Divine trait ([ ] or any card) to add a card that has the Divine trait from your discard pile to your hand ([ ] or to allow a character at your location to add a card from his discard pile to his hand). If your combat check has the Attack trait, add 2 ([ ] 3) to it. ([ ] You may also add the Fire trait.) [ ] You gain the skill Perception ([ ] and Survival): Charisma +2.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Tempest oracles draw on the power of the sun. When they do, seek the shade.
At a young age, Alahazra was struck blind and began exhibiting supernatural powers. Accused of being a follower of the gods, she was driven from her atheist home in Rahadoum into the desert. Although the experience almost killed her, she emerged with the realization that her abilities came not from any deity, but from the powers of the sun and flames. Now Alahazra travels the world, exposing any injustice she encounters with her scouring light.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: You may recharge a card that has the Divine trait to examine the top card of any location deck ([ ] or the blessings deck or any character deck). At the end of your turn, you may discard a card that has the Divine trait to add a card that has the Divine trait from your discard pile to your hand. If your combat check has the Attack trait, add 2 ([ ] 3) ([ ] 4) to it. ([ ] You may also add the ([ ] Electricity or) Fire trait.) [ ] When you play a spell that has the Attack trait, you gain the skill Arcane: Charisma +2 until the end of the encounter.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Strength: d4 [ ] +1 Desterity: d4 [ ] +1 Consitution: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Intelligence: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Knowledge: Intelligence +2 Wisdom: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 Charisma: d12 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Divine: Charisma +2

property.name: Attr4
property.value: [ ] Light Armors

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Duelists are the pinnacle of swordplay, moving with grace and lethality.
Jirelle lost everything the day her mother's ship, the Bloodcrow, sank off Tempest Cay. Surviving the wreck, she soon learned of the ship's ghostly reappearance. Now Jirelle pits her rapier and wits against the Shackles' countless dangers. Every treasure she uncovers goes into her thricelocked chest, a trove meant to finance a ship and crew. Donning her mother's cape, the cloak of the Bloodcrow Queen, Jirelle scours eastern Garund for relics and treasure, determined to use them to uncover the mystery of the Bloodcrow.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6 Spell: - Armor: 1 [ ] 2 [ ] 3 Item: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Ally: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6 Blessing: 5 [ ] 6

property.name: Attr1
property.value: For your check that has or is against a card that has the Finesse trait, you gain the skill Melee: Dexterity +2 ([ ] +3). If your check has the Swashbuckling trait ([ ] or is a check to defeat a ship), you may reroll 1 die ([ ] or 2 dice) on your check; you must take the second result. Reduce STructural damage to your ship by 1. [ ] When you defeat a monster on your turn, and your check to defeat has the Swashbuckling trait, you may discard ([ ] or recharge) a card to immediately explore. [ ] When you acquire a card that has the Finesse or Ranged trait, you may immediately recharge it to draw a card. [ ] You may recharge an ally to recharge a random card ([ ] or a weapon of your choice) from your discard pile. [ ] If any die rolled on your check is an 8 or higher, roll 1d4 and add it to the result.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Pirate queens are beholden to no one. It's their ocean; you just sail on it.
Jirelle lost everything the day her mother's ship, the Bloodcrow, sank off Tempest Cay. Surviving the wreck, she soon learned of the ship's ghostly reappearance. Now Jirelle pits her rapier and wits against the Shackles' countless dangers. Every treasure she uncovers goes into her thricelocked chest, a trove meant to finance a ship and crew. Donning her mother's cape, the cloak of the Bloodcrow Queen, Jirelle scours eastern Garund for relics and treasure, determined to use them to uncover the mystery of the Bloodcrow.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Freebooters jump from ship to ship, unfettered by any crew.
Born a slave to human nobles in a land corrupted by devils, Lem was blessed with a quick wit that earned him easy work as an entertainer. He managed to escape from bondage, but had to leave friends and family behind. Now he fights to ensure that no one else has to bear the burdens that weigh upon his memory. His greatest weapons are his easy laugh, his repertoire of inspirational music and tales, and - when need be - his quick blade.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: You may recharge a card to add 1d4 ([ ] +1) ([ ] +2) ([ ] +3) to any check by a character at your location. When you would recharge a card, you may shuffle it into your deck instead. For your check that has or is against a card that has the Finesse trait, you gain the skill Melee: Dexterity +1. For your check that has or is against a card that has the Firearm trait, gain the skill Ranged: Dexterity +2 until the end of the encounter. When you encounter a bane that has the Task ([ ] or Pirate) trait ([ ] or a ship), you may recharge any number of allies; for each ally recharged, add 1d6 to the check to defeat the bane. When you play a blessing on any check that has the Swashbuckling ([ ] or Firearm) trait, add a d12 instead of the normal die.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Sea singers keep up a crew's morale with a variety of chanties.
Born a slave to human nobles in a land corrupted by devils, Lem was blessed with a quick wit that earned him easy work as an entertainer. He managed to escape from bondage, but had to leave friends and family behind. Now he fights to ensure that no one else has to bear the burdens that weigh upon his memory. His greatest weapons are his easy laugh, his repertoire of inspirational music and tales, and - when need be - his quick blade.

For your check that has or is against a card that has the Finesse trait, you gain the skill Melee: Dexterity +1. [ ] Add 1d4 ([ ] 2d4) ([ ] 3d4) to your non-combat check to defeat a bane ([ ] or ship). [ ] For your combat check against a bane that has the Aquatic trait, you may use your Diplomacy skill +1d6 and add the Magic and Mental traits; you may additionally discard a card to add another 1d8. property.name: Attr4
property.value: [ ] Light Armors, [X] Weapons

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Deadeyes learn to seek and destory anything that might kill them.
Lirianne always dreamed of becoming a shieldmarshal, like her father. With his help, she learned to draw schematics, engineer firearms, and quick-draw pistols. As a vigilant warden, Lirianne spent years safeguarding her homeland in Alkenstar... until a burst of wild magic blew in from the Spellscar Desert. The arcane catastrophe summoned bizarre creatures and struck down the only shieldwarden who stood against them. Wounded, she awoke on the shores of Avistan, where she now wanders a world far from home.

property.name: Attr2

property.name: Attr1
property.value: When you play a weapon that has the Firearm trait, if you would bury it or shuffle it into your deck, you may keep it and instead perform the required action with another card. You may shuffle a card from your hand into the deck to add 1d4 ([ ] +1) ([ ] +2) ([ ] +3) ([ ] +4) to any combat check at another location. [ ] When you encounter a bane, you may attempt a Perception check with a difficulty of 5 plus the adventure deck number of the bane, if any, to evade it. [ ] When you are on a ship and a random ship and a random ship is summoned, you may draw 2 ([ ] or 3) such cards and choose 1. [ ] When you would fail a combat check that has the Firearm trait, you may discard a weapon to add 1d4 to your result. [ ] When you move to a different location during your move step, you may examine the top card of that location deck ([ ] and shuffle it into the deck).

Musketeers are adept with both swords and guns, leading toops by clearing out foes.
Lirianne always dreamed of becoming a shieldmarshal, like her father. With his help, she learned to draw schematics, engineer firearms, and quick-draw pistols. As a vigilant warden, Lirianne spent years safeguarding her homeland in Alkenstar... until a burst of wild magic blew in from the Spellscar Desert. The arcane catastrophe summoned bizarre creatures and struck down the only shieldwarden who stood against them. Wounded, she awoke on the shores of Avistan, where she now wanders a world far from home.

property.value: [X] Light Armors, [X] Weapons

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
In the alleyways, these rogues know all the places to hide--for example, right behind you.
Orphaned at a young age and raised by humans in the slums, the elf Merisiel saw many friends grow old and die in the decades it took her to become an adult. Unfettered by responsibilities, she now travels where her curiosity takes her, wandering the world with those she calls friends at the time. Merisiel believes in experiencing life to the fullest - you never know when you'll meet an unexpected end - and that there are few problems a dagger can't solve.

[ ] When a monster deals damage to you before ([ ] or after) the encounter, reduce that damage to 0. [ ] You automatically succeed at your Knowledge check.

If you need something, even if it's someone else's, call on these rogues.
Orphaned at a young age and raised by humans in the slums, the elf Merisiel saw many friends grow old and die in the decades it took her to become an adult. Unfettered by responsibilities, she now travels where her curiosity takes her, wandering the world with those she calls friends at the time. Merisiel believes in experiencing life to the fullest - you never know when you'll meet an unexpected end - and that there are few problems a dagger can't solve.

property.name: Attr4
property.value: [X] Light Armors, [ ] Weapons

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Marauders don't need a cannon to punch a hole in your ship.
The bastard son of a Chelish noblewoman and an elven outlaw, Seltyiel was raised by his abusive stepfather. As a teenager, he fled his home to seek out his true father, a painful search that ended in rejection and, ultimately, imprisonment by Hellknight manhunters. In the depths of a Chelish dungeon, his magic awoke, a voice spurring him on to power and revenge. Arcane ambition has driven him ever since, a passion that won't be sated until both his fathers are dead.

The bastard son of a Chelish noblewoman and an elven outlaw, Seltyiel was raised by his abusive stepfather. In the depths of a Chelish dungeon, his magic awoke, a voice spurring him on to power and revenge. Arcane ambition has driven him ever since, a passion that won't be sated until both his fathers are dead.

property.name: Flavour
property.value:
Corsairs are fierce rovers of the sea who insist that "corsair" just sounds more trustworthy than "filthy pirate."
Valeros is a good-hearted former mercenary whose longing for adventure convinced him to flee an arranged betrothal to a farmer's daughter. He trained himself in swordplay and spent many years as a mercenary, but now he fights for those in need. Though noble of heart and fiercely loyal, Valeros hides such sentiments under a jaded and crass demeanor, frequently observing that there's nothing better than "an evening of hard drinking and soft company."

property.value: At a young age, Alahazra was struck blind and began exhibiting supernatural powers. Accused of being a follower of the gods, she was driven from her atheist home in Rahadoum into the desert. Although the experience almost killed her, she emerged with the realization that her abilities came not from any deity, but from the powers of the sun and flames. Now Alahazra travels the world, exposing any injustice she encounters with her scouring light.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: - Spell: 5 [ ] 6 [ ] 7 [ ] 8 Armor: - [ ] 1 Item: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Ally: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 Blessing: 5 [ ] 6 [ ] 7

property.name: Attr1
property.value: You may recharge a card that has the Divine trait to examine the top card of any location deck ([ ] or the blessings deck or any character deck). At the end of your turn, you may discard a card that has the Divine trait to add a card that has the Divine trait from your discard pile to your hand. If your combat check has the Attack trait, add 2 to it. ([ ] You may also add the Fire trait.)

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Strength: d4 [ ] +1 Desterity: d4 [ ] +1 Consitution: d6 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 Intelligence: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Knowledge: Intelligence +2 Wisdom: d8 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 Charisma: d12 [ ] +1 [ ] +2 [ ] +3 [ ] +4 Divine: Charisma +2

property.name: Attr4
property.value: [ ] Light Armors

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Jirelle lost everything the day her mother's ship, the Bloodcrow, sank off Tempest Cay. Surviving the wreck, she soon learned of the ship's ghostly reappearance. Now Jirelle pits her rapier and wits against the Shackles' countless dangers. Every treasure she uncovers goes into her thricelocked chest, a trove meant to finance a ship and crew. Donning her mother's cape, the cloak of the Bloodcrow Queen, Jirelle scours eastern Garund for relics and treasure, determined to use them to uncover the mystery of the Bloodcrow.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6 Spell: - Armor: 1 [ ] 2 [ ] 3 Item: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Ally: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6 Blessing: 5 [ ] 6

property.name: Attr1
property.value: For your check that has or is against a card that has the Finesse trait, you gain the skill Melee: Dexterity +2. If your check has the Swashbuckling trait ([ ] or is a check to defeat a ship), you may reroll 1 die ([ ] or 2 dice) on your check; you must take the second result. Reduce STructural damage to your ship by 1.

property.value: [X] Light Armors, [X] Weapons

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Born a slave to human nobles in a land corrupted by devils, Lem was blessed with a quick wit that earned him easy work as an entertainer. He managed to escape from bondage, but had to leave friends and family behind. Now he fights to ensure that no one else has to bear the burdens that weigh upon his memory. His greatest weapons are his easy laugh, his repertoire of inspirational music and tales, and - when need be - his quick blade.

property.name: Attr2

property.name: Attr1
property.value: You may recharge a card to add 1d4 ([ ] +1) ([ ] +2) to any check by a character at your location. When you would recharge a card, you may shuffle it into your deck instead. For your check that has or is against a card that has the Finesse trait, you gain the skill Melee: Dexterity +1.

property.name: Attr2

property.name: Attr4
property.value: [ ] Light Armors, [X] Weapons

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Lirianne always dreamed of becoming a shieldmarshal, like her father. With his help, she learned to draw schematics, engineer firearms, and quick-draw pistols. As a vigilant warden, Lirianne spent years safeguarding her homeland in Alkenstar... until a burst of wild magic blew in from the Spellscar Desert. The arcane catastrophe summoned bizarre creatures and struck down the only shieldwarden who stood against them. Wounded, she awoke on the shores of Avistan, where she now wanders a world far from home.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6 [ ] 7 Spell: - Armor: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Item: 2 [ ] 3 [ ] 4 Ally: 3 [ ] 4 Blessing: 4 [ ] 5 [ ] 6

property.name: Attr1
property.value: When you play a weapon that has the Firearm trait, if you would bury it or shuffle it into your deck, you may keep it and instead perform the required action with another card. You may shuffle a card from your hand into the deck to add 1d4 ([ ] +1) ([ ] +2) ([ ] +3) to any combat check at another location.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Orphaned at a young age and raised by humans in the slums, the elf Merisiel saw many friends grow old and die in the decades it took her to become an adult. Unfettered by responsibilities, she now travels where her curiosity takes her, wandering the world with those she calls friends at the time. Merisiel believes in experiencing life to the fullest - you never know when you'll meet an unexpected end - and that there are few problems a dagger can't solve.

property.name: Attr2
property.value: Weapon: 3 [ ] 4 [ ] 5 Spell: - [ ] 1 [ ] 2 Armor: 1 [ ] 2 Item: 5 [ ] 6 [ ] 7 [ ] 8 Ally: 2 [ ] 3 Blessing: 4 [ ] 5

property.name: Attr1

property.name: Flavour
property.value: The bastard son of a Chelish noblewoman and an elven outlaw, Seltyiel was raised by his abusive stepfather. As a teenager, he fled his home to seek out his true father, a painful search that ended in rejection and, ultimately, imprisonment by Hellknight manhunters. In the depths of a Chelish dungeon, his magic awoke, a voice spurring him on to power and revenge. Arcane ambition has driven him ever since, a passion that won't be sated until both his fathers are dead.

property.name: Attr1
property.value: Choose a weapon that doesn't have the 2-Handed trait and a spell that has the Attack trait. When you play one for your combat check, you may recharge the other ([ ] or shuffle it into your deck) to add 1d6 ([ ] 2d6) and that card's traits to the check. Before you reset your hand, you may attempt to recharge a spell in your discard pile.

property.name: Flavour
property.value: Valeros is a good-hearted former mercenary whose longing for adventure convinced him to flee an arranged betrothal to a farmer's daughter. He trained himself in swordplay and spent many years as a mercenary, but now he fights for those in need. Though noble of heart and fiercely loyal, Valeros hides such sentiments under a jaded and crass demeanor, frequently observing that there's nothing better than "an evening of hard drinking and soft company."
